rules_mdDesc:
PermissionSet - Permissions Admin Policy gives visibility on access permissions related to Manage Profiles and Permission Sets, Manage Sharing, Multi-Factor Authentication for User Interface Logins, Manage Auth. Providers, Manage Custom Permissions, Manage Login Access Policies, Manage Password Policies, Allow Password Never Expires, Manage Session Permission Set Activations, Exempt from Transaction Security, Waive Multi-Factor Authentication for Exempt Users.

This violation means that this Permission Set conflicts with your policy for these settings.

Compliant Solution

Review the configuration of this Permission Set. If it is acceptable, you can change the status to Safe.
When marked safe, this issue will only show up again if one of the other policy rules in this set are violated. You can review what has been marked as safe at any time using the filters at the top of the page.

See

  • MITRE, CWE-522 - Insufficiently Protected Credentials

rules_name: Avoid Excess Workflow Rules per Object
rules_mdDesc: Objects which contain too many decisions are complex and difficult to maintain.
Salesforce does not allow more than 15 cross-object formulas per object.
Salesforce does not allow more than 40 relationships per object.
